segment.source: Labeling Data in ACM (Windows 10)
segment.target: Labeling Data in ACM (Windows 10)

segment.source: Application data and its associated compatibility issues can vary within an organization.
segment.target: Application data and its associated compatibility issues can vary within an organization.

segment.source: Labeling Data in ACM
segment.target: Labeling Data in ACM

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: Application data and its associated compatibility issues can vary within an organization.
segment.target: Application data and its associated compatibility issues can vary within an organization.

segment.source: For example, the applications used by a Human Resources (HR) department might differ from the applications used by a Sales department.
segment.target: For example, the applications used by a Human Resources (HR) department might differ from the applications used by a Sales department.

segment.source: Even for applications that are used across an organization, different compatibility issues might be found for each business group because of the unique application use by each business group.
segment.target: Even for applications that are used across an organization, different compatibility issues might be found for each business group because of the unique application use by each business group.

segment.source: Your data-collection packages can add a label to your inventoried applications.
segment.target: Your data-collection packages can add a label to your inventoried applications.

segment.source: To filter by business group when analyzing reports, you can create a different data-collection package for each business group and have each package assign a unique label.
segment.target: To filter by business group when analyzing reports, you can create a different data-collection package for each business group and have each package assign a unique label.

segment.source: For example, you can create a data-collection package for your Sales department with a Sales label.
segment.target: For example, you can create a data-collection package for your Sales department with a Sales label.

segment.source: During reports analysis, you can filter your results so that only the data with the Sales label is visible.
segment.target: During reports analysis, you can filter your results so that only the data with the Sales label is visible.

segment.source: You can specify a label when you create a data-collection package.
segment.target: You can specify a label when you create a data-collection package.

segment.source: You cannot change the label for an existing data-collection package.
segment.target: You cannot change the label for an existing data-collection package.

segment.source: To specify the label for a new data-collection package
segment.target: To specify the label for a new data-collection package

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), on the Go menu, click Collect.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), on the Go menu, click Collect.

segment.source: On the Collect screen, click File from the toolbar, and then click New to start creating a new data-collection package.
segment.target: On the Collect screen, click File from the toolbar, and then click New to start creating a new data-collection package.

segment.source: In the wizard, enter the label that you want to be applied by the data-collection package.
segment.target: In the wizard, enter the label that you want to be applied by the data-collection package.
